publishedfiledetails.title: [Scripted] Betrayal at House on the Hill - With Stats Auto-Haunt and Traitor Loading
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Betrayal at House on the Hill is a co-op (well... partially) exporation game where you and a few friends explore a haunted mansion together... Until one of your friends betrays you... or you betray them!

Also, a new version with the Widow's Walk expansion has been released! Check that one out at
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=789737297

[img]https://i.imgur.com/U6bHWZp.png[/img][url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198040676166/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160][img]http://u.cubeupload.com/Mark/followbutton.png[/img][/url][img]http://u.cubeupload.com/Mark/spacing.png[/img][url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198040676166][img]https://i.imgur.com/LWGzncA.png[/img][/url][img]http://u.cubeupload.com/Mark/spacing.png[/img][url=https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=JSZNA2U8WVE9Q&lc=US&item_name=Steam%20Donations&currency_code=USD&bn=PP%2dDonationsBF%3abtn_donateCC_LG%2egif%3aNonHosted][img]http://u.cubeupload.com/Mark/donatebutton.png[/img][/url]

This mod has scripted functions that includes:
	- Auto-loading the haunts and corresponding pages
	- Determining who is the traitor
	- Easier tracking of the stats
   	- (NEW FEATURE) Selects and changes the color of the hidden zones to the traitor's color

What this mod can't do:
	- Rolls the dice for you (hey, quit being lazy... and I'm too lazy to program that right now so...)
	- AI players (ok, this would be cool... maybe some day...)

If there are any bugs or issues or speling arrors, please leave a comment and I'll endevor to fix it. 

If you have an idea for a feature, let me know! I'd love to know how i can further improve this for you guys!

Changelog:
	- 7/18: Fixed a issue where Missy's might stat would load to the wrong position.
	- 8/4: Added an automatic color change for the hidden zones around the survivor and traitor tomb books.

If you like this game, I suggeest getting it IRL and supporting the awesome creators and playing it with you non-digital friends!

The base table and cards and models and... well everything except the scripting if I'm honest, is from Aphoristic's Betrayal at House on the Hill (2nd Edition) on the Steam Workshop, so thanks to him and all the others he's credited (Weakstream, Friedslick6, and Bonnie Lass) for making this awesome game available!

Thanks for subscribing and have fun!

If, for whatever reason, you'd like to show support and buy me a pizza or something: paypal.me/GiantDwarf01

publishedfiledetails.title: Star Wars: The Queen's Gambit
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Star Wars The Queen's Gambit
Thumb's up if you like it!

Star Wars The Queen's Gambit was published in 2000. The objective of the game is to conquer the oposing team  across 4 different battlefields. Teams are represented by 155 miniatures on three separate boards, including a three-level palace.

The action is driven by two decks of cards for each side. Each turn, each side simultaneously chooses four action cards from a hand of ten, and places them in order. The actions are then carried out one at a time, alternating sides. Combat is resolved using special attack and defense dice.

2 or 4 players
Make sure you shuffle all of the decks before you start. The many game pieces are already set in place according to official rules.

Full game instructions can be found here: http://www.hasbro.com/common/instruct/StarWars,TheQueen'sGambit.PDF

*This is not my original boardgame. I created original 3D models that resemble the original models of the physical version. Only play this game if you own the physical version. It's an awesome game and I hope you enjoy! Let me know what I can do more to make it even more fun. 

Please RATE so more people can see it :D 

If you appreciate my streams, please donate: https://www.twitchalerts.com/donate/kba_allstar

Thanks so much!

publishedfiledetails.title: Sword & Sorcery - Fantasy Setup (Immortal Souls)
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
WHAT IS SWORD & SORCERY

Sword & Sorcery is an epic-fantasy cooperative board game in which 1-5 players fight together against the forces of evil, which are controlled by the game system itself.

Each player controls one or more heroes – legendary characters brought back to life by powerful sorcery. Weakened by the resurrection, they grow stronger during their story-driven quests. By acquiring soul points during battles, the heroes' souls regenerate, restoring their legendary status with multiple powers, magic and soul weapons, and powerful artifacts.
(Description from the publisher)

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


WHAT'S INSIDE

- Full scans of the entire game (retail version)
- Custom background
- Kraken table
- Custom dice
- Universal dice roller
- 3D Standees (I tried scanning the minis, but that didn't came up to good)
- Custom 3D models and designs
- Orbs of music (to change/turn off music right click any orb and select a looping effect)
- Weather buttons for snow, fog, rain (to change/turn off effect right click the button and select looping effect)
- Rulebook, Storybook and Book of Secrets
- Custom Deck Mats (small and big, with discard piles)
- Custom Tuckboxes for the decks of cards

All the scans and editing was done by me.
90% of the 3D models and custom content was also created by me, while some that were mostly used for bags and prop were taken from the workshop.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


WHAT WILL BE ADDED

- Automated scenario setup (using SkyTools)
- Scripts
- Other ideas I might have
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


NOTE

Most of the tokens, coins, HP trackers, etc use states. To change a state you can right click the item and choose 1,2,3 etc from the dropdown menu, or simply press 1,2,3, etc on your keyboard!

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


CREDITS

I do NOT own any credits for this game or it`s content.
All rights go to the respective owners:
Designer: Simone Romano, Nunzio Surace
Artist: Mario Barbati, Fabrizio Fiorentino, Phroilan Gardner, Fausto Gutierrez
Publisher: Ares Games, Gremlin Project

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


USEFUL LINKS

BGG Forums: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/170771/sword-sorcery/credits
Official Website: http://www.sword-and-sorcery.com/
Publisher Website: http://www.aresgames.eu/games/sword-and-sorcery-line

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

If you like the game, consider buying a physical copy and supporting the creators.
Thank you!

publishedfiledetails.title: [ENG+RUS] Sub Terra Full (All Expansions)
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
[b]Sub Terra Full[/b] включает в себя переведённые планшеты персонажей (за исключением трёх дополнительных), карточки предметов из Investigation и таблички с подсказками.

[url=https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wg5KogBQsdea5bB-Uj8-JpJGTylOrHKt/view]ПРАВИЛА НА РУССКОМ (pdf)[/url]

[b]Sub Terra[/b] is a team-based push-your-luck game. Together, you'll decide what risks are worth taking and when. The caves is a dangerous place - no matter how well you plan, things WILL go wrong, and your survival depends on how well you react to unforeseen circumstances. 

[img]https://i.imgur.com/MxNxRBi.png[/img]

[url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/itbboardgames/sub-terra-a-cooperative-survival-horror-game-for-1]Sub Terra's Kickstarter Page.[/url]

[url=https://drive.google.com/open?id=0BwY07A_2afcTcmIxRWlIbE9rcGs]ENGLISH RULEBOOK (pdf)[/url]

[b]YOUR OBJECTIVE:[/b] Escape the cave before you run out of time.
1) [b]CAVERS:[/b] Everyone picks a caver, and gives that caver 3 health points. There are eight characters to choose from in Sub Terra - each has unique abilities that change how they play.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/HRmAMoe.png[/img]

2) [b]TILES:[/b] Cavers begin the game on the START TILE. You're all trying to get to the EXIT TILE, which is near the bottom of the TILE STACK.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/YfV9HFa.png[/img]

3) [b]ACTIONS:[/b] Every round, each caver has two action points to spend (and can risk a health point for a third) 

The basic actions are: 

[list]
[*][b]Reveal[/b] (Flip the top tile of the stack and place it a gap next to your current location) 
[*][b]Move[/b] (Move to an adjacent connected tile) 
[*][b]Explore[/b] (Reveal a tile, then immediately Move onto it. Faster, but riskier!) 
[*][b]Heal[/b] (You or another caver on your tile regains one health point)
[*][b]Run[/b] (Move three times) 
[/list]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/SLwbS3S.png[/img]

Together, you must place tiles as quickly as possible while not getting too spread out. Why not run off by yourself? Well…

4) [b]HAZARDS:[/b] At the end of each round, resolve the top card of the HAZARD DECK. Each affects a certain type of tile: cavers on those tiles will lose health, and the tile may become harder to traverse. For example, GAS hurts cavers on GAS TILES a medium amount, whereas a FLOOD hurts those on WATER TILES only a little but makes the tile twice as costly to enter in the future.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/keX6V6g.png[/img]

If you lose all your health points, you fall UNCONSCIOUS - you're unable to take further actions until another caver reaches your tile and HEALS you. If a friend is nearby, this won't take long. If you've strayed too far down a side passage, it might take some time to reach you. Why does that matter? Well…

[img]https://i.imgur.com/9uG8PuY.png[/img]

5) [b]RUNNING OUT OF TIME:[/b] When the hazard deck runs out of cards, your flashlights are nearly out of power: instead of resolving a card, each caver has a chance of getting lost in the darkness forever. Turns are precious - time spent rescuing fallen cavers or backtracking through difficult passages is time you'd rather spend uncovering more tiles and getting closer to the exit.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/RFeMvz4.png[/img]

6) [b]HORRORS:[/b] You're not alone down here. Some hazard cards can spawn...things...which will relentlessly hunt you down. If they catch you, you'll immediately lose all health points and fall unconscious. If you try to fight them, you will die. RUN.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/IN9GfvM.png[/img]

7) [b]MORE STUFF:[/b] Sub Terra also contains: cave-ins, squeezes, ledges, slides, ropes, rough treacherous terrain, tremors, dynamite, cave diving, "geology" and soul-crushing despair 

(soul-crushing despair supplied separately)

[img]https://i.imgur.com/KmFEH02.png[/img]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/MNzrACl.png[/img]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/WIjhZmS.png[/img]

publishedfiledetails.title: Unbroken - The Board Game
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Check out how successful the Kickstarter campaign was and also a chance to Pre-Order the game. ( https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1227872561/unbroken-a-solo-game-of-survival-and-revenge?ref=nav_search&result=project&term=unbroken )

The module has been updated using the latest PnP provided by the game designer Artem Safarov. Along with the improved graphic layout and larger Encounter deck size an "Achievements" sheet has been added to track your accomplishments in game. Use the little blue marbles which will snap into place. All of the "cube" spaces will snap into place when a cube is placed near them. This should help keep things a little cleaner and less manipulation on the player side.

From the Website "http://altemagames.com/unbroken/" :
Not all adventures end well. Some parties meet their untimely demise at the hands of monsters all too soon and Unbroken is a story of one such ill-advised expedition. The player takes on the role of the sole survivor of such failed adventure. Finding themselves in hostile territory, weak and wounded, the players will need to gather their wits and strength, craft weapons from scraps found around them and attempt to tackle progressively more challenging monsters on their way out of this forsaken place.
Unbroken is a solo card game that is quick to set up and play but one that will produce a tense challenging experience.

Please record the outcomes of your plays - this will help balance the game in advance of the release. Use this form : https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc86fiyeZAIEQk357kwKqSux7jQe_SFFDUO2GjpOKEU8UkY9w/viewform

Please visit the Board Game Geek page for more information about the game: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/225885/unbroken

Rules can be found here: 
http://altemagames.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Unbroken-Rulebookv6-1.pdf

The PnP file can be downloaded here: http://altemagames.com/unbroken/playtesting/

I personally created this module using the components of the PnP which is publicly available and with the permission of the game designer Artem Safarov.

publishedfiledetails.title: Mass Token Import (Tool)
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Recently I had to import over 390 custom tokens... and after 2 days I still had another few 100 more to do!! It was so slow and painful having to copy and paste the token, right click it, select custom, alt tab, get the url, tab back, paste the url, hit import... and repeat!!

So I made this quick and dirty solution for importing 100s of token images into TTS. All you do is make a template object, drop it on the tool, and then copy all your urls into the text tool and hit the button. So much faster.

At this time, as that was all I needed, this script only works on the default TTS "CUSTOM TOKEN" object.. but the method can be easily adapted to all custom objects. If there is interest I could expand the mod.. but it is what it is at this time!

[h1][b]UPDATED 14/01/2018[/b][/h1]

[list][*]It now works on all objects in TTS (apart form custom decks and asset bundles)
[*]It now can read off two url lists.
[*]List 1 = image slot 1 or diffuse map for custom OBJs
[*]List 2 = image slot 2 or normal map for custom OBJs
[*]Imported objects are placed inside a Bag to be neat. You can save this to your chest and then import it into any mod you are working on.
[*]GoogleDrive and Dropbox RAW links, will be rephrased automatically. So you can paste raw links form those sites into the mod and it will work.[/list]

To use only 1 image list, simply select the 2nd list and select all and delete. The default "empty" for a text field says "Type Here". This means empty as far as the mod is concerned.

If you want to use two urls lists then they MUST be the exact same length of lines, as in have the same number of URLs in each list.

Instructions : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BxLUW6z_Ztc

[h1]How to use[/h1]
• Create 1 Token as a "template" for all your other tokens.
• Make a text file of all your URLs, 1 URL per line. If you use DropBox or GoogleDrive you can simply select all the images and get the urls in one click.
• Paste your URL list into TTS, but selecting the TEXT TOOL and editing the TEXT FIELD in the mod. Just simple ctrl+v to paste it in. (remember to delete anything I had in the tool)
• Drop your template token onto the tool
• Press the button

• After it has finished, press the button next to the bag and it will spit everything out of the bag into the table to fix GUID issues and load all the images into your TTS cache. 
• When all the loading is done you will notice a button at the base of the table to pack everything backup into the bag

• Save the compleated bag to import into your mod.
• Enjoy your hours of extra time by going for a surf with your kids.



[h1]Thanks[/h1]

big thank you to [b]dzikakulka[/b] for helping me with some of my typical noob-like scripting questions. This mod wouldn't be here with out him.

publishedfiledetails.title: Pocket Black Hole (scripted trash bag)
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
This is a simple tool. While closed, it is a standard prop. When open, it is a bag that destroys any object which tumbles into it. Switch between its modes by clicking the center of the device.

It is just meant to be a fun item with some functionality. Special thanks to [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/chries/myworkshopfiles/]CHRY[/url] for making the model and effects so I could make an updated, nicer looking version to an old toy.

As for scripting examples, this shows how to trigger Looping Effects, using setCustomObject to change the object type and deleting objects in a bag automatically.

publishedfiledetails.title: Final Fantasy TCG Complete
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Final Fantasy Trading Card Game (English)

Features
- A custom game board to play on 
- All the current cards (Opus 1-4 and promos)
- Built in ruleset and video tutorial, perfect for beginners 
- 30+ premade decks to pick up and start playing right away.
- Snap points and card outlines for easy card placement
- Detailed tips and tricks to make playing more convenient
- Custom sleeved versions of the starter decks
- Plenty of room to build and manage decks
- Easily save and load player made decks for reuse.
- Named and alphabetically sorted cards for easy searching
- Phase Tracker
- Custom FF themed coin and D6
CHECK THE NOTEBOOK FOR MORE INFO AND HELPFUL TIPS

DISCORD SERVER LINK: [url=https://discord.gg/CqTWxEZ] HERE [/url] 

Notes
------------------------------------------------------------
I'll do my best to keep the mod updated for each new card set 
and fix any possible issues with the mod.

Don't forget to support the game and your local game store IRL!

A notifications will appear when you start the mod. This is to allow a Final Fantasy 
music playlist to begin playing on the tablet in the bottom left. Check "Don't ask again for this player" so it doesn't show up again when you take out the video tutorial or reload the game.

**SOME PEOPLE HAVE REPORTED ISSUES WITH THE TABLET. TRY HITTING CANCEL IF YOU RUN INTO ANY PROBLEMS. IF YOU PREVIOUSLY TICKED "DON'T ASK AGAIN FOR THIS PLAYER," YOU MAY HAVE TO QUIT TO THE MAIN MENU BEFORE YOU TRY LOADING IT AGAIN. **

The mod can take up to a few minutes to fully load. Just be patient.

PLEASE RATE THE MOD AND TELL ME WHAT YOU THINK IN THE COMMENTS!

Credits
------------------------------------------------------------
@ [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/LDericher/myworkshopfiles/] LDericher [/url] for creating a tool that easily imports card images into tabletop simulator & the fully sorted and sized opus 6 cards.
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198045202311/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] Grandjason [/url] for the custom board image
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Junpei/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] Gunso [/url] and beepboop for the opus 1 and 2 cards + promos
@ [url=http://www.fftcgmognet.com/] fftcgmognet.com [/url] and [url=https://ffdecks.com/] ffdecks.com [/url] for the card images.
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/DankDarko/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] Bakersfield Prime [/url] for the rpg style chest/bag
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/foxxinaboxx/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] FoXX(); [/url] for the 3 metal chests 
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198048308461/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] Eruyome [/url] for the 360° background
@ [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/theShazbot/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] Scootaloo [/url] for the custom coin model.
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/MrStump/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] MrStump [/url] for the memory bag 2.0 that holds all of the card sets.
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198058300407/myworkshopfiles/] XericChaosdive [/url] and [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/TipsyHobbit/myworkshopfiles/] TipsyHobbit [/url] for the card untapper scripting.
@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/TheJester/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] Jester [/url] for the card untapper model.
@ [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZM7H0-grf_0ggnVpp-tQqg] Six Sages Gaming [/url] and [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx6m8lIxLc_OQGmZ9LBRZMQ] Josephyr [/url] for the premade decks added into the game. 
DON'T FORGET TO RATE AND SUPPORT THEIR PAGES TOO!

@ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198046960183/myworkshopfiles/?appid=286160] Me [/url]
- Phase tracker script
- Custom sleeved decks 
- Custom coin and D6
- Custom turn structure and starter guide cards 
- Snap points and card outlines
- Card sizing, naming, sorting, and placement
- Opus 3, 4, and promo cards 

Known issuses
------------------------------------------------------------
- Some people have reported the tablet causing crashes 
for them on load. Try hitting cancel on the prompt messages
to try and circumvent these issues. If you previously hit
"dont ask again for this player," you may have to quit to 
the main menu before loading it again. 

- There are only enough snap points for 7 forwards
although there is no limit to how many you can have.

- There's a possibility for an ad to play before the music.

- There's no art when searching the premade decks unless all the card sets are placed first.

- There are a few alternate art promos that still aren't added. 

- With the new update to hands for tabletop simulator, cards can have some awkward overlap.

- I removed the card counter tool until I can get it working again.

Changelog/Updates
------------------------------------------------------------
Version 1.0 
- Initial release
Version 2.0 
- Opus 2 card set
- Card outlines to the board for easier snapping
- Custom FF themed coin and D6
- Phase tracker 
- Names for each card
- Sleeved decks now display correctly in hands  
Version 2.1
- Sorted the opus 1 and 2 sets alphabetically for easier searching
- Added the tutorial videos to the mod page
- Added a tablet open to a F.A.Q. page for advanced rulings
- Fixed one of the FF13 decks that had the wrong Gilgamesh 
Versions 2.2
- Added 30 Premade decks to the game (25 from opus 1 and 5 from opus 2)
- Added a link to a F.A.Q. and advanced rules page and put them in a chest.
- Changed the Final Fantasy music playlist.
Version 2.3
- Added Opus 3 Starter Decks (FF9 and Type-0)
Version 3.0
- Added all the Opus 3 cards.
- Added MrStump's memory bag 2.0 for faster loading.
- Put all of the starter decks into a chest.
- Added a button to untap all of your cards at once.
- Added a card counter to deck and break zones.
Version 3.1
- Added more premade decks including a new chest for opus 3 decks.
- Added tokens for keywords and buffs to power.
- Added alternate art cards. They can be found with the promo cards.
- Added sleeved versions of Type-0 and FF IX starter decks.
- Changed the music playlist.
- Fixed Cinque's card text.
Version 3.2
- Fixed an issue with the card untapper.
Version 4.0
- Added all the Opus 4 Cards and 3 new promos.
- Added 5 new Opus 3 premade decks.
- Moved all the card sets to a side table for more space.
Version 4.1
- Added higher quality images for all of the opus 4 cards.
- The sideboard is no longer attached to the memory bag.
Version 4.2
- Added premade decks for Opus 4.
- Removed the card counters while I work on a fix for them.
- Added 2 new camera angles that zoom in on the board.
Shift + 1 zooms in on White's side.
Shift + 2 zooms in Green's side.
Spacebar resets to default camera angle.
Version 4.3
- Added 4 new premade decks for Opus 4.
- Changed the music playlist.
Version 4.4
- Added 51 Cards from Opus 5 (Image quality may vary) 
- Added instructions in the notebook on how to let spectators interact with objects.
Version 5.0
- Added all the Opus 5 Cards and the new starter decks.
Version 6.0
- Added all the Opus 6 Cards (courtesy of LDericher)
Version 6.1
-Fixed an issue with the Opus 6 card backs.
Version 7.0
- Added all the Opus 7 Cards (courtesy of LDericher)
- Added the Opus 7 Hero and Villain Starter Decks.
- Changed the music playlist.

Possible Future Updates (No promises!)
------------------------------------------------------------
- Add future Opus cards
- Add more premade decks
- Add more alternate art cards/promos
- Add a place for monster cards to go
- A skip turn button for the phase tracker
- A draw/mulligan button
- A card counter for hand size and damage
- Cleaner scripts and added functions
- Reduce load times

publishedfiledetails.title: Arkham Horror (Nameless Edition)
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
To the best of my knowledge, this is the best quality Arkham Horror mod available.  It is also the most complete. (The only things missing are 2 semi-offical scenario series made by the European publisher.)

It has every single component ever made by Fantasy Flight, including all expansions, promotional cards, and Internet exclusives.

The mod was based on the mods listed below.  I did an awful lot of scanning, graphic editing, and re-organizing to get this mod to where it is now.  I hope you enjoy it.  I doubt that I'll find any more time to work on this in the future, so I'm considering this to be my final version. Although, if you need some bug fixing done, feel free to ask.

This mod uses components from [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=666273389]Zebra Nation's mod[/url], which in turn uses components from [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=628594853]Dweemish's mod[/url] and [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=472180921]ScreamInVain's mod[/url], which in turn (in addition to a lot of original scanning) use some graphics scanned for [url=arkhamhorrorwiki.com]The Arkham Horror Wiki[/url] as well as an old Vassal mod (the author of which I don't know).

A brief list of changes and additions:
- Curse of the Dark Pharoah (Revised) added.
- The Lurker at the Threshold added (low res).
- Miskatonic Horror added (low res).
- Two missing Kingsport Horror heralds added.
- Promotional items, giveaways, and trade-ins have been added.
- New game boards.
- New monster tokens through Kingsport Horror.
- New gate markers through Kingsport Horror.
- New Slider texture.
- New table texture (taken from the Arkham Horror manual).
- Slightly cleaner layout.
- Various new tokens.

Saga expansions up to "The Flame of the West"

publishedfiledetails.title: Vess's Faction Pack-Humans Part 2
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Included in this pack are:

-90 new human character models

-2 new bags! Treasure chest (Open and closed versions)

-Custom Human city background featured in the previous collection

As promised here is the other half of the human RPG models I have been working on! Unlike the first half, every single model featured here is created from the newer high poly characters from World of Warcraft rather than the older lower poly base models. Over the past few weeks i've spent a considerable amount of time trying to create a diverse array of textures, dynamic poses and sometimes custom objects for each piece. This is still an evolving process as I look for the most effective and efficient way to produce quality content in large batches. The archers and crossbowmen for example have a loading, aiming and firing model with 3 different face and skin textures each. There are still MORE unfinished models I have for this collection that I will continue to update and add as time goes on.

As always, I appreciate any feedback from you guys on what you think, what I should change/fix or do next! 


Hope you find some of this useful in your RPG or war gaming sessions! For more models and map collections remember to please like, comment, and follow to get the latest addition to my growing pile of junk! 
Workshop Link: 
[img]http://i.imgur.com/nKTE321.png[/img][url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198007307508/myworkshopfiles/] [img]http://i.imgur.com/MZdbNuh.png[/img] [/url]

Note:I do not own any of the textures or assets used in the creation of this mod and are property of Activision Blizzard, Inc.

publishedfiledetails.title: Arkham Horror [ENG]
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Welcome to Arkham!

The year is 1926, and it is the height of the Roaring
Twenties. Flappers dance till dawn in smoke-filled
speakeasies drinking alcohol supplied by rum runners
and the mob. It’s a celebration to end all celebrations in
the aftermath of the War to end all Wars.
Yet a dark shadow grows in the city of Arkham. Alien
entities known as Ancient Ones lurk in the emptiness
beyond space and time, writhing at the gates between
worlds. These gates have begun to open and must be
closed before the Ancient Ones make our world their
ruined dominion.

Only a handful of investigators stand against the
Arkham Horror. Will they prevail?

Arkham Horror is a game for 1 to 8 players (3 to 5
recommended), playable in 2 to 4 hours. The game is set
in the fictional town of Arkham, Massachusetts, made
famous by H.P. Lovecraft in his writings about the
Cthulhu mythos.

Full eng version with all cards

Rules: https://images-cdn.fantasyflightgames.com/ffg_content/Arkham_Horror/AH_Rules_internat.pdf

publishedfiledetails.title: Ultimate X-Wing Miniatures Extra Large Table & Player Trays - All Ships
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
This is not original work - all models and pieces were gathered from all of the other X-Wing Miniatures workshop items and arranged together here. Extra large table pushes the ship pieces away from the game board giving you more room. Each ship has the proper pilot card and movement reference card/deck nearby.

Hidden zones near the center of the board and player hands in the trays. High resolution board image and game background.

There are about 1700+ items to load - may take a little bit. You may see the memory limit warning and likely need ~2.8GB of extra RAM on your system.

Check change log for more details: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/changelog/596944942

Source Mods:
 - https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=414561503&searchtext=x-wing
 - https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=415295765&searchtext=x-wing+complete

publishedfiledetails.title: Snake Tower Dice Roller
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Roll dice by dropping them into Snake Tower!  Just a static model for use in whatever game you wish. Inspired by the Deluxe Tower of RNG Doom.

I'm a novice 3D modeller, and crappy painter, so this is a best shot at something I could use in my dice-rolling games.  Dice very occasionally get stuck, but I have fun throwing them down and seeing how it works out!  

Remember to keep the model locked, or dice will not fall through, and instead just sit on top in the air.  You can drop dice against the side of the tower, and they will fall in because of the funnel at the top.

publishedfiledetails.title: Star Wars: Imperial Assault + Waves 1-9
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Imperial Assault Campaign for up to 5 players, one playing the Imperial player and up to four playing Rebel Heroes, both sides trying to achieve victory over the other.

This file should be seen as a means to play the game over long distances with others. You still need the campaign books to follow the campaign as they will not be provided.

This workshop item will keep the items required for Campaign play for Imperial Assault and contain the following products:

Imperial Assault Core Game
Twin Shadows Expansion
Return to Hoth Expansion
The Bespin Gambit Expansion
Jabba's Realm Expansion
Wave 1-9 including everything from Campaign Play

Besides the official items for the game I inted to add custom content, mainly from people from Boardgamegeek.com, as well as my own additions, so far the following have been added:

Theek Bok: Rebel Hero [Fully Implemented]
Gutter: Rebel Hero [Fully Implemented]

-----

Upcoming custom campaign (The Call of the Dark Side) consists of the following:

[WIP 90%] Rix Andar / Academy Outcast - Rebel Hero (Hero Card, Hero Deck, 3 Rage Tokens, 3 Light Tokens)
[WIP 0%] Nima Orum / Imperial Infiltrator - Rebel Hero (Hero Card, Hero Deck)
[WIP 0%] Zadir Vrec / Gamorrean Hunter - Rebel Hero (Hero Card, Hero Deck)
[WIP 0%] Bados Basara / Dug Technician - Rebel Hero (Hero Card, Hero Deck)

[WIP 0%] 9 Side Missions with Cards and Maps (4 Red, 4 Green, 1 Grey)
[WIP 0%] 6 Core Missions with Cards and Maps (The Call of the Dark Side)
[Fully Implemented] 1 New Condition (Burning)

[Tweaking] CIS Deployment Deck (Taken out to be remade)
[Fully Implemented] New Cards for Rebel's, Imperial and Mercenary Deployment Decks

[Fully Implemented] Imperial Class Deck - Flame Assault (Condition Inflicting Trooper Deck)

[WIP 0%] Campaign Guide for The Call of the Dark Side

-----

Theek Bok's Side Mission PDF: https://www.dropbox.com/s/3n3py3qzun4ol0d/Tusken%20Trouble.pdf?dl=0
Gutter's Side Mission PDF: https://www.dropbox.com/s/ubhal42ipmgdrsx/My%20War%20Never%20Ends.pdf?dl=0

-----

Any questions or suggestions will be answered as well as I can, happy gaming everyone!

publishedfiledetails.title: Dominion
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
The intention of this mod was to combine quality, functionability and being visually identifiable for Tabletop Simulator. In saying that, pretty much everything in this mod was remade by me from the ground up. No dodgy cropping, no low resolution scans and no absurdly high file sizes (every expansion's randomizer is below 5 megabytes).
Each card is also named in this mod for easier searching, be it for tallying up Victory Points at the end of the game, or quickly snatching something out of the randomizers.

What you will find in this mod:
•Dominion 2nd Edition
•Dominion Intrigue 2nd Edition
•Dominion Seaside
	-Embargo tokens
	-Pirate Ship tokens
	-Island mats
	-Native Village mats
•Dominion Alchemy
•Dominion Prosperity
	-Trade Route mat
	-VP tokens
•Dominion Cornucopia
•Dominion Hinterlands 
•Dominion Dark Ages
•Dominion Guilds
	-Coin tokens
	-Coffers mats
•Dominion Adventures
	-Events
	-Tavern mats
	-Adventures tokens
•Dominion Empires
	-Landmarks
	-Events
	-Debt tokens
•Dominion Nocturne
	-Hexes
	-Boons
	-States
•Dominion Renaissance (*Still missing are the wooden boxes for the Projects, and the Villagers mat*)
	-Artifacts
	-Projects

•Basic Supplies Box
•Events & Landmarks Box
•Promos & Cut cards Box (specifically the 1st Edition cards that were removed)
•Bag containing some other miscellaneous items, such as Supply, Non-Supply, Bane and Event/Landmark mats, and the Coin/Debt/VP tokens.

publishedfiledetails.title: Advanced 5th Edition Dungeons and Dragons Table
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
This table has everything needed for 6 players and a DM to host a game. Character sheets with built in bullets for information, Tablets set to Roll20.net and many tokens. 3d probs and building are also included in the mix. I hope you enjoy this as it's a collection of many other workshop mods all smashed into one home.

I recommend downloading DnD 5e Kit from the workshop as well. Just grap the little white bag in the middle of the table and save it to your chest. This little bag has made MASSIVE improvements to the table I uploaded and feel bad that I uploaded it prior to finding this little gem. If the person that uploaded that kit ever gets to see this section of my upload, thank you very much. 

The following list is other Items that I recommend finding on the Workshop. I used bits and pieces of each of these downloads to create what was uploaded, and wouldn't have been able to build it without these creators uploads.

3D Props and models. Indoor and outdoor environment dressings.

RPG Drama Cards

DnD5e

5th Edition Dungeos and Dragons Table (Massive callout for this one. This table is beautiful and where I put all the work into. Thank you a ton to whoever built this!)
Various Models - Ruins and Buildings and Rocks

Pathfinder Table

Dungeon Tile Playset (118 Pieces)

I want to say thank you to anyone that downloads this and enjoys it. Great deal of work went into this and I had a blast doing it. Good luck in your sessions out there guys!

publishedfiledetails.title: Blokus 20x20
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Pieces snap to grid and are able to interlock together.

I used this project to learn how importing custom models works. Figured I would share this since the other version of Blokus is currently not working correctly because of the collision boxes.


: Known Issues :

• Parts of some of the pieces don't collide with anything.
     - This is the only way I know how to get the pieces to be able to interlock with each other atm.

• Sometimes the colors of the pieces don't load properly
     - Not sure why this is, but having the host go to Host > Workshop and reloading the game seems to solve the issue.

publishedfiledetails.title: Arkham Horror
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
[Sorry in advance for my English, I am not a native English speaker]

So this is it! My very first mod! Arkham Horror. The wonderful never aging adventure board game from 2005.


Several versions of this game are already availables for Tabletop Simulator, but I found myself the need to make another one, one with a full quick setup, where everything is ready to play and where you can add expansions in less than two minutes. [b]All Expansions are included.[/b]
I took [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=899417131&searchtext=arkham+horror] Arkham Horror - Expanded Horror Edition [/url] by KaosWarMonk as a base who himself used elements from many others Arkham Horror mods, so go see their page and give them a thumb up 'cause they deserve one.


In this mod, you will find two big tables:
The main one contains the base game fully setted up with all Investigators, Ancient Ones, Heralds, Institutions, Guardians, etc. ready to be picked up for a quick game start. Some expansion non-thematic cards like Personal Stories, Relationships, Injury/Madness, Epic Battle Decks, etc., are also here ready to be picked up. Common/Unique Items, Spells, Skills and Monsters (except Masks and Spawns) from all expansions have been merged together into the base game.
On the Other Table, you will find all "thematics" parts of the expansions from Dunwich to Miskatonic organized in columns for an easy and quick implementation onto the main table. The cards from Miskatonic Horror are already added into theirs respectives decks (Except from the Mythos deck). All rulebooks from all expansions are included into the game.

Don't hesitate to hover the mouse on objects if you want some rule specifications because I putted some annotations to help new players discover the game. I also putted text annotations directly on board.
I scripted a very simple Auto Shuffle on cards and bags who needs it on loading to the game, but as I am not a very good coder myself, it is a very simple one and it is not as perfect as I would want it to be, but maybe I will improve it in the future.

If you are lost with this setup, ask me in the comments and i will respond if I'm around.

The Url the game ask you to launch when launching the game is safe, it opens a link to a very good Youtube playlist that will add some atmosphere to your games. (Sorry if commercials launch sometimes instead of music, it happens and I can't change this..).


If you like this game and don't have it's physical version yet, go buy it on [url=https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror/] Fantasy Flight Games website[/url].

publishedfiledetails.title: Edge of the Empire Table
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Here's an RPG table set up for use with FFG's Edge of the Empire. With this table you'll find hundreds of resources to make your game awesome!

The assets included are rounded up from the various other EoE workshop things on here and now consolidated into one place. I also added in some ships from Armada.

The Character Sheets are editable.

JUST so people are aware, this is not simply a curated table. I have assets on there that I custom made. The music cubes alone took several hours to learn how to make and implement. Don't think because SOME of this is curated, that the whole thing is. All I ask for is that if you use this mod, you just give some credit.


Update 11.1.2017: 

Added in a custom model 'bag' item for some things to give it a more sci-fi feel. Bags are still use for some items.

Added in the sound-board player and a custom sound object with some Cantina Music from Soundcloud. I plan on adding some more music in the future in a series of different music cubes. If you have any song suggestions from Soundcloud, let me know. I am trying to keep clear of the 'big' copyrighted tracks and stick to using covers.

Shifted a few things around to make it look better.

Update 12.1.2017:

I went ahead and added in the second custom sound cube with a few themes (Main theme, etc). Added some more minis to the lot.


More feedback is appreciated!! :D

publishedfiledetails.title: Cry Havoc w/ Expansion
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Cry Havoc is an asymmetric, card-driven area control game for 2-4 players. Each player controls one of the four unique races and fights viciously to gather the most Crystals on the planet, which will more than offset the costs of the conflict. To do this, players must customize their decks of cards, Build powerful Structures, and leverage their unique Skills to gain victory.

Rulebook : http://portalgames.pl/files/rules/cryhavoc_rules_www.pdf
Aftermath Expansion Rulebook : https://portalgames.pl/en/cry-havoc-aftermath-rulebook/

The board is setup for both a 2 player game or a 3-4 player game. Board State 1 for 2 player , and Board State 2 for 3-4 player games. 
 
Many Tokens and other objects use States to represent the the backs of tokens and the hidden information that is revealed when encountered. After placing tokens on the board they default to the back of the token. Change the state of the token by pressing 2 to reveal the token text.

Due to the rotation limitation on TTS I had to create 3 HQ states for all factions . Toggle through the states on the HQ Token when placing during setup to find the correct rotation for your HQ location.

This has now been updated to include the Aftermath Expansion. Take a look at what i've made and let me know if there is anything that needs changed and I can hopefully get that fixed. Otherwise enjoy the expansion and its many customizable options. 

Enjoy!! 

Note: I do not claim any rights to this game.

publishedfiledetails.title: Chaotic
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
The base-game featuring the series 1 Dawn of Perim cards.

Big thanks to DanielsWorlds for contributing a large portion of the expansions!

[h1]Expansions[/h1]
Click on one of the expansions below to view it!
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=698041827]Zenith of the Hive[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=698747006]Silent Sands[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?edit=true&id=751286362]M'arrillian Invasion[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=897628033]Rise of the Oligarch[/url] (DanielsWorlds)
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=898173652]Turn of the Tides[/url] (DanielsWorlds)
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=898192343]Forged Unity[/url] (DanielsWorlds)
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=898206333]Alliuances Unraveled[/url] (DanielsWorlds)
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=898214054]Promos[/url] (DanielsWorlds)


[h1]Description[/h1]
Chaotic is a card game in which two players battle creatures for supremecy. Using battlegear, mugic (magic based on music), abilities, and attacks, the players must defeat each other using strategy, wit, and a little bit of luck.

Chaotic was a card game that originally ran alongside a 4Kids TV show with a similar name. With the closing of the website in 2012, the game has since died down severely. During the game's lifetime, multiple series' of cards were originally released, however only series one: Dawn of Perim, is featured in this mod.

This mod provides the full game to experience as if from the beginning of Chaotic's lifecycle. All the original cards are present, along with the original playmats used to play the physical card game.

[url=http://chaoticbackup.forumotion.com/]If you're looking for a place to meet up with other Chaotic fans, there is a forum that is home to a lot of fellow players![/url]

[h1]Regarding the Quality of the Cards[/h1]
I really wish I could have provided high-quality images for cards and the playmat, but sadly there are very few resources available for Chaotic. I could have easily recreated the cards in a higher resolution, however the problem is I would need to recreate [i]every[/i] card, meaning looking up stats and finding the original artwork for each individual card. Creatures would be easier, since some of the artists actually uploaded their work on the creatures to DeviantArt, however attacks, mugic, and other cards would be extremely difficult. 
For now, my main concern is that it's playable and somewhat readable. I hope you understand. Thank you!

If there are any issues with stats, feel free to post a comment on what cards need correcting. I'll be more than happy to make those corrections! Thank you!

[h1]Features[/h1]
* The full Series 1: Dawn of Perim set of cards.
* A full-size playmat for the players to utilize. Featuring snap points for ease of placement.
* Decks organized by tribe and type for ease of search.
* Mugic tokens to help keep track of creatures' mugic.
* Snap positions on the side panel for placing a token to help keep track of creatures' energy during combat.


[h1]How to Play[/h1]

[url=http://www.chaoticgameplus.com/images/howtoplaychaotic.htm]Full documentation on the game can be found here[/url]
...or alternatively around other parts of the internet.

Games are strictly locked to two players, with as many spectators as you desire. The rules do allow for varied amounts of creatures on the field depending on the desired length of the game. 
The rules support modes for the following amount of creatures on the battlefield:
* 1v1
* 3v3
* 6v6
* 10v10

[h1]QUICK START[/h1]
[b](Setup)[/b]
1. To begin a match, each player choose the desired amount of creatures depending on the type of gamemode agreed on. 
2. Battlegear may be selected for each individual creature the player controls.
3. Place the battlegear face down under the creature card, and place the creature card ontop.
4. Then, players must gather 20 attack cards, making sure the sum of all attack values (the number in the upper left of all attack cards) does not exceed 20.
5. Each player then gathers 10 location cards.
6. Players then must make their attack and location decks face down, and shuffle both decks. Both players must then place the decks on the indicated spots on the game board.

[b](Gameplay)[/b]
1. At the beginning of each players' turn, the player must select the top card from their location deck. This is the location at which the players will be fighting if combat is initiated.
2. Players then have the choice of either moving (if any open spaces are available), or attacking (You can only attack adjacent opponent cards).
3. If the attack phase is initiated by a player, the one who goes first is determined by the "Initiative" on the location card. For instance, if the initiative is Power, then the player who has the most power on their attacking creature goes first.
4. Combat is locked to the attacking creature, and the attacker creature. The players will draw 3 attack cards and take turns using attacks, abilities, battlegear, or mugic. Once a player has used an attack card it is returned to the "Attack Discard" pile. Upon completely using up all attack cards, the player takes the Attack Discard pile, shuffles it, and reuses it.
5. Once combat has finished, the losing creature must be sent to the owner's "Discard" pile along with their battlegear. The winner then gets to choose whether they wish to move one adjacent space in any direction or if they wish to stay where they are. The location card is sent to the bottom of the player's pile and then the opposing player begins their turn.

publishedfiledetails.title: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
[b]Support the cool guys :) [/b] 
http://czechgames.com/

[h1]Rules:[/h1] http://czechgames.com/files/rules/through-the-ages-new-story-rules-en.pdf
[h1]Handbook:[/h1] http://czechgames.com/files/rules/through-the-ages-new-story-handbook-en.pdf

[u]Inform me if something is missing or should be added![/u]


[b]ABOUT[/b]
[i]Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization[/i] is the new edition of Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization, with many changes small and large to the game's cards over its three ages.

Through the Ages is a civilization building game. Each player attempts to build the best civilization through careful resource management, discovering new technologies, electing the right leaders, building wonders and maintaining a strong military. Weakness in any area can be exploited by your opponents. The game takes place throughout the ages beginning in the age of antiquity and ending in the modern age.

One of the primary mechanisms in TTA is card drafting. Technologies, wonders, and leaders come into play and become easier to draft the longer they are in play. In order to use a technology you will need enough science to discover it, enough food to create a population to man it and enough resources (ore) to build the building to use it. While balancing the resources needed to advance your technology you also need to build a military. Military is built in the same way as civilian buildings. Players that have a weak military will be preyed upon by other players. There is no map in the game so you cannot lose territory, but players with higher military will steal resources, science, kill leaders, take population or culture. It is very difficult to win with a large military, but it is very easy to lose because of a weak one.

Victory is achieved by the player whose nation has the most culture at the end of the modern age.

publishedfiledetails.title: D&D Figurines: 3.5 Monster Manual
publishedfiledetails.file_description: (NOT FINISHED)  This is my in-progress attempt at creating figurines for use in D&D games.  Since I lack the knowledge and ability to do custom 3D modeling, these figurines are 2D models.  This is still very much not finished but there are a few people who requested what I had so far, so I figured I would upload what I have for now.  Expect updates in the future, and any criticism and advice is welcome.

publishedfiledetails.title: Fallout: Mutants and Wastelands
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Настольная игра "Fallout: Mutants and Wastelands" — это "Драконы и Подземелья" [D&D] для Tabletop Simulator в сеттинге Fallout.

Представьте, что классические Fallout перенесли на правила настольной игры, но сохранили ролевую модель оригинала. Вы кидаете кубик, выкладываете карточки, слушаете гейммастера и продумываете билд персонажа на основе вашего опыта игры в старые Fallout. 

В игре есть пошаговая система боя, S.P.E.C.I.A.L., аутентичная карта мира и классический набор оружия и брони, 6 слотов на игроков и 1 геймейкер. 

Fallout: D&D удобна для обкатки с друзьями ваших идей и сценариев, механик, а также позволяет испытать уникальный опыт ролевого отыгрыша. 
Если любите Fallout, настольные ролевые игры и хотели бы поиграть в их смесь с друзьями по интернету, то это, вероятно, то, что вам подойдёт! 
============================================== 
Проект был вдохновлён Game of Pagy (GoW) S.T.A.L.K.E.R
==============================================
Ссылки:
Группа VK: vk.com/mutants_and_wastelands
Создатель: vk.com/wetton

publishedfiledetails.title: Pandemic Legacy: Season 1
publishedfiledetails.file_description:
Pandemic Legacy - Season 1 is a unique and epic cooperative game for 2 to 4 players. Unlike most other games, some of the actions you take in Legacy will carry over to future games. What's more, the game is working against you. Playing through the campaign, you will open up sealed packets, reveal hidden information, and find the secrets locked within the game. The clock is ticking and you will only have two chances to win in a month before moving to the next.

Characters will gain scars. Cities will panic. Diseases will mutate. No two worlds will ever be alike!

Custom models added from the following mods:
Secret Hitler
Table Boarder Extention (Extra Space)
Customizeable Deckboxes (Legion)

If you experence any problems please comment and I will fix them a.s.a.p.!

Thank You!

Special thanks to AcidLies for letting me copy his save when I completely screwed up.
